notes: All effects of Smoke Screen are provided by an aura and its debuff lingers for 0.5 seconds
Successive casts, including from different sources, do not update the current ability values but refresh its duration
Although the debuff lingers, its effects instantly stop if the target turns invulnerable and hidden

Stacks additively with other sources of blind
 Blind uses pseudo-random distribution

While channeling [picture:tricks_of_the_trade] Tricks of the Trade, Smoke Screen has an [picture:instant_cast_time] instant cast time and does not require facing the target area to cast, as long as the targeted point is within cast range The channeling itself does get interrupted, but the ability continues with its effects In this state, new ⇧ Shift-queue orders cause Tricks of the Trade to get completely canceled

notes: Riki gets all 2 charges immediately upon learning Blink Strike

Blink Strike always teleports Riki behind the target
 Does not disjoint projectiles upon teleporting
Can be cast on allies without damaging them
Riki is ordered to attack the target if it is an enemy

The bonus damage is independent from Riki's attack damage and it is considered as spell damage
 The bonus damage is instantly dealt to the target
 This means they do not trigger any attack modifier or on-hit effects, and ignore evasion
 However, damage block affects them

Blink Strike first applies the slow debuff, then the bonus damage, then Riki's attack damage, then the attack animation bonus
 This reduces Riki's attack animation to 0.15+0.15 for the next attack

When targeting an enemy, Riki receives a hidden buff This buff makes the next attack apply an ensured backstab hit with [picture:cloak_and_dagger] Cloak and Dagger based on its current level, regardless of the target's facing angle This means if the target manages to turn around before Riki's attack hits, it still applies the backstab damage Cloak and Dagger damage notes fully apply If it is not learned, the backstab damage is not applied The buff lasts for 1 attack, or for up to 1 second, whichever happens first The buff is used up upon starting an attack, not upon landing it, so canceling or missing the attack wastes it The 1-second duration allows Riki to use the ensured backstab damage against other units than the Blink Strike target
Cannot be cast on invulnerable and hidden units, buildings, [picture:animal_courier_radiant_minimap] Couriers and wards
[picture:counterspell] Counterspell does not reflect Blink Strike However, it is still blocked
Blink Strike has a 0.1-second cooldown to prevent accidental double-casts on the same target

Causes Riki to perform instant attacks on 1 ([picture:aghanim's_scepter_symbol] 2) enemies within range in 0.67 ([picture:aghanim's_scepter_symbol] 0.5)-second intervals, starting immediately upon cast, resulting in 4 ([picture:aghanim's_scepter_symbol] 5) instances These instant attacks can proc any attack modifiers and on-hit effects normally They do not have True Strike, but completely ignore disarms Since the damage comes from a regular attack, it counts as attack damage and not as spell damage Fully affect enemy [picture:animal_courier_radiant_minimap] Couriers This means it is affected by damage block, unaffected by spell damage amplification, and cannot spell lifesteal

Tricks of the Trade first checks Riki's total [picture:agility_attribute_symbol] agility and grants the agility bonus, and then reduces his main attack damage This can be defined as (43 + ΣAgi × 155%/170%/185%/200%) × 40% The agility bonus lasts as long as the channel time, and only the ability can use it

During Tricks of the Trade, [picture:cloak_and_dagger] Cloak and Dagger based on the current level triggers on every attack, regardless of the enemy's facing angle Cloak and Dagger damage notes fully apply If it is not learned, the backstab damage is not applied
The instant attacks do not break [picture:smoke_of_deceit] Disguise and Cloak and Dagger's invisibility, although Cloak and Dagger visually go on cooldown
Does not affect invisible units, but does affect units inside the Fog of War

The visual effects indicating Tricks of the Trade's attack radius are visible to both allies and enemies The attack radius is always centered on Riki and follows him even when he gets moved (e.g with [picture:glimpse] Glimpse) However, a part of the radius indicating visual effects on the ground does not follow Riki, and stays at the cast location

Riki reappears at the center of the ability after the max channel time
 ↓↓ Double-tapping automatically moves Riki to the targeted location within the cast range

The projectile travels at a speed of 1600

Applies sleep on affected units, preventing them from acting, until woken up

 The counter counts damage after all reductions

Sleeping units are never automatically attacked, regardless of auto attack settings This means that sleeping units are never attacked by lane creeps, neutral creeps, towers and fountains Players can still force an attack order on the target ([picture:keyboard_white_mouse_right] Right Click or A)

notes: Riki does not auto-attack enemies while invisible
Riki starts off invisible and does not need to go through the fade delay when he respawns or during reincarnation
Casting abilities or using items does not break the invisibility

The ability icon shows a cooldown whenever the invisibility is broken However, this has only informative purposes The cooldown is not affected by any cooldown reduction and cooldown resets sources Both [picture:time_dilation] Time Dilation and [picture:chakra_magic] Chakra Magic affect the cooldown visually, but do not affect the fade delay in any way
Backstab damage is also applied when attacking and denying allies Fully affect enemy [picture:animal_courier_radiant_minimap] Couriers Treats illusions and creep-heroes as heroes

description: Remains permanently invisible until the moment to strike. Leaving his past life behind, Riki escaped the royal grounds using his own Cloak-and-Dagger methods. Stealthy and fond of killing from behind, Riki throws down a dense Smoke Screen, blinding and choking foes as he takes them by surprise with Blink Strike. Intruders who enter his turf is greeted with twin daggers, flashes of steel that slash simultaneously at every turned back, or being tranquilized by his signature Sleeping Dart, while the master himself remains unseen. How this feat is accomplished remains a mystery, for the Stealth Assassin is not one to divulge his Tricks of the Trade.  Carry Escape Disabler ★☆☆
trivia: In DotA, Riki was named "Rikimaru" (力丸), a reference to one of the main characters in the Tenchu video game series. The name is carried over to Riki's official Chinese hero name.
Riki's fun/alternate name was Riki Martin, which is a pun on Ricky Martin, a famous Latino pop singer.
Riki's line upon dying, Link▶️ "Good assassins never die… they just fade away.", is a reference to a quote by General Douglas MacArthur, "Old soldiers never die; they just fade away."
Riki's line Link▶️ "There are none so stabbed as those who will not see." is a reference to a proverb: "There are none so blind as those who will not see."
Riki's line Link▶️ "I speak softly, but carry a sharp knife." is a reference to the West African Proverb "Speak softly and carry a big stick.", popularized by U.S. president Theodore Roosevelt.
history: Riki was born middle child to the great dynasty of Tahlin. With an older brother groomed for the throne, and a younger brother coddled and kept, Riki, the small middle son, seemed born for the art of invisibility. It was an art he cultivated, and one which ultimately saved his life on the night that his people were betrayed and his family slaughtered. Of all the royal line, he alone escaped—small and agile, unassuming, using smoke as cover. He cut his way out of the royal grounds, using the advantage of surprise, quietly slitting the throats of one enemy warrior after another. Now free of his royal responsibilities, Riki uses his talents in service to a new trade: Stealth Assassin. He silences his enemies, sharpening his skills, hoping to one day take revenge on those who killed his family and robbed him of his birthright.
